t: When will the Amazon hit a tipping point?
s: Most fires in the Amazon are intentional — set either by farmers to fertilize soil or by ranchers to clear deforested land for cattle. In wet years, the fires spread less easily, but in drier years, more trees die and flames surge higher, says Brando. Once a forest is hit by fire, patches become drier and thus more flammable: “The forest turns ...
